name: Vegetables-and-Dip Pita Pocket
description: Children can enjoy the fun combination in these pita pocket sandwiches. Each bite delivers the crunch of vegetables and the creaminess of dip. Sweet pickles add a little excitement to each bite. You can swap the standard pairing of carrots and celery for other crunchy vegetables you enjoy raw, like fennel, cucumber or peppers.
keywords: appetizer, main course, greek yogurt, labneh, pickles, pita, tahini
recipeIngredient: 1/2 cup thinly sliced celery (from 1 large stalk)
1/2 cup thinly sliced carrots (from 1 peeled carrot)
4 tablespoons labneh or plain Greek yogurt

recipeInstructions.text: Toast the pita just until warm and pliable.

In a medium bowl, toss the celery and carrots with the olive oil and 1/4 teaspoon salt to coat. Divide the bean dip and yogurt between the cavities of the pita halves, then stuff with the celery-carrot mix, pickle slices and parsley.
Serve or wrap tightly in foil, plastic wrap or wax paper and pack for lunch.
